meanings.definition: Small broken pieces of something, especially food or a building.
meanings.sent1: The chef sprinkled the crumblings of cheese on top of the salad.
meanings.sent2: I swept up the crumblings of the old wall to clean the floor.
meanings.sent3: The ants were having a party with the crumblings of the cookie crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The crumblings of the ancient ruins whispered stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The child's hands were covered in the crumblings of the sandcastle, a sign of a day well spent.

meanings.definition: The act of breaking into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: With a loud crunch, the crumblings of the cookie shattered on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The crumblings of the vase lay scattered on the table after it fell.
meanings.sent3: The crumblings of the cracker rebellion were quickly cleaned up by the vacuum.
meanings.sent4: The crumblings of trust in their relationship slowly drifted apart.
meanings.sent5: The crumblings of the ice cream cone fell to the ground, much to the dog's delight.

meanings.definition: The process of disintegrating or falling apart.
meanings.sent1: The crumblings of the old book signaled its inevitable decay.
meanings.sent2: The crumblings of the cliff edge warned of the impending collapse.
meanings.sent3: The crumblings of the sandcastle were no match for the incoming tide.
meanings.sent4: The crumblings of the relationship left a trail of broken hearts.
meanings.sent5: The crumblings of the once grand building now lay in ruins, a testament to time's passage.
